channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Marin restores key flood pump after months of setbacks from supply chain
item.description: The first of the season’s king tides, which can cause roadway flooding in the area, was expected today, Nov. 5, alongside a 90% chance of rain.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon arts commission turns to parks for feedback on street-sign exhibit
item.description: Los Angeles artist Scott Froschauer's public-art proposal will go before the parks board Nov. 18.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Cinelounge Tiburon plans to bring vertical movies to big screen
item.description: Submissions for the inaugural Marin Vertical Film Festival opened Nov. 4 and run through June, with the festival scheduled for next October.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon resident looks to assess well-being with ‘vitality index’
item.description: Factors can be anything from how a person perceives their relationships with others and how healthy they feel to their environmental stewardship or creative pursuits.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A real-estate investor eyes a future in law enforcement
item.description: Sebastian Rivas has built a successful career in real-estate investing, but he says he’s ready for a change.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Travel Bug: Exploring the high country offers fresh approach to Yosemite
item.description: Over the past three years, I have been questioning whether Yosemite was worth the frustration.
item.dc:creator: Marybeth Bond-Sheppard

item.title: Neighbors threaten lawsuit over Strawberry senior-care project
item.description: The five-story, 150,655-square-foot building would house 106 units on a vacant lot at 70 N. Knoll Road, standing more than 60 feet tall.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister
